article.paragraph: File:Nrrebrogade - beginning.jpgthumbleftDronning Louises Broleading intoNrrebrogadeVesterbro, CopenhagenVesterbro, to the southwest of Indre By, begins with theTivoli Gardens, the city's top tourist attraction with its fairground atmosphere, itsPantomimeteatretPantomime Theatre, itsTivolis KoncertsalConcert Halland its many rides and restaurants.cite webhttp://www.copenhagenet.dk/cph-map/cph-tivoli.aspTivoliCopanhagenet.dk27 November 2013TheCarlsberg (district)Carlsbergquarter has some interesting vestiges of the old brewery of the same name including theElephant Gate and Tower, CarlsbergElephant Gateand theNy Carlsberg Brewhouse.cite webhttp://www.carlsberggroup.com/Company/heritage/Pages/footprints.aspxIn the Footprints of Carlsberg's foundersCarlsberg Group27 November 2013TheTycho Brahe Planetariumis located on the edge ofThe Lakes, CopenhagenSkt. Jrgens S, one of the Copenhagen lakes.cite webhttp://planetariet.dk/englishAbout the PlanetariumTycho Brahe Planetarium27 November 2013Halmtorvet, the old haymarket behind theCopenhagen Central StationCentral Station, is an increasingly popular area with its cafs and restaurants. The former cattle market ksnehallen has been converted into a modern exhibition centre for art and photography.cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/vesterbroVesterbroVisit CopenhagenRadisson Blu Royal Hotel, built by Danish architect and designerArne Jacobsenfor the airlineScandinavian Airlines System(SAS) between 1956 and 1960 was once the tallest hotel in Denmark with a height ofconvert69.60monand the city's only skyscraper until 1969.cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Kunst_og_kultur/Arkitektur/Danmark/SAS-hotellet?highlightSAS-hotellet''Den Store Danske''7 December 2013DanishCompleted in 1908,Det Ny Teater(the New Theatre) located in a passage betweenVesterbrogadeandGammel Kongevejhas become a popular venue for musicals since its reopening in 1994, attracting the largest audiences in the country.cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/det-ny-teater-gdk414422Det Ny TeaterVisit Copenhagen8 December 2013
article.heading: Nrrebro
article.paragraph: File:Gefion fountain, Copenhagen.jpgthumbTheGefion FountainNrrebroto the northwest of the city centre has recently developed from a working-class district into a colourful cosmopolitan area with antique shops, ethnic food stores and restaurants. Much of the activity is centred onSankt Hans Torv.cite webhttp://www.aok.dk/byliv/guide-to-noerrebroGuide to: NørrebroAOK28 November 2013Copenhagen's historic cemetery,Assistens Cemetery (Copenhagen)Assistens Kirkegrdhalf way up Nrrebrogade, is the resting place of many famous figures includingSren Kierkegaard,Niels BohrandHans Christian Andersenbut is also used by locals as a park and recreation area.cite webhttp://www.kk.dk/da/brugbyen/brug-steder-i-byen/groenne-omraader/kirkegaarde/assistens-kirkegaardAssistens KirkegårdKøbenhavns Kommune28 November 2013Danish
article.heading: sterbro
article.paragraph: Just north of the city centre,sterbrois an upper middle-class district with a number of fine mansions, some now serving as embassies.cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Danmarks_geografi_og_historie/Danmarks_geografi/K%C3%B8benhavn/%C3%98sterbroØsterbro''Den Store Danske''28 November 2013DanishThe district stretches from Nrrebro to the waterfront where the statue ofThe Little Mermaid (statue)The Little Mermaidcan be seen from the promenade known asLangelinie. Inspired byHans Christian Andersen's fairy tale, it was created byEdvard Eriksenand unveiled in 1913.cite webhttp://www.copenhagenpictures.dk/mermaid.htmlThe Little MermaidCopenhagen Pictures28 November 2013Not far from the Little Mermaid, the oldKastellet, CopenhagenCitadel(Kastellet) can be seen. Built byChristian IV of DenmarkChristian IV, it is one of northern Europe's best preserved fortifications. There is also a windmill in the area.cite webhttp://www.highways.dk/kobenhavn-kastellet/Henrik LangeKastellet ved Langelinie – Københavns smukke fæstningsanlægHighways.dk26 September 201330 November 2013DanishThe largeGefion Fountain(Gefionspringvandet) designed byAnders Bundgaardand completed in 1908 stands close to the southeast corner of Kastellet. Its figures illustrate a Nordic legend.cite webhttp://www.kobenhavnshistorie.dk/bog/kko/g/kko_g-13.htmlJens FleischerGefionspringvandetSelskabet for Københavns Historie198530 November 2013Danish
article.heading: Frederiksberg
article.paragraph: File:Frederiksberg Slot set fra plnen.jpgthumbleftFrederiksberg PalaceStrictly speaking a separate municipality,Frederiksberglies to the west of Nrrebro and Indre By and north of Vesterbro. Its landmarks includeCopenhagen Zoofounded in 1869 with over 250 species from all over the world andFrederiksberg Palacebuilt as a summer residence by Charles IV who was inspired by Italian architecture. Now a military academy, it overlooks the extensive landscapedFrederiksberg Gardenswith itsfollies, waterfalls, lakes and decorative buildings.cite webhttp://www.danishnet.com/info.php/travel/frederiksberg-attractions-360.htmlFrederiksberg Tourist AttractionsDanishnet.com1 December 2013The wide tree-lined avenue ofFrederiksberg AllconnectingVesterbrogadewith the Frederiksberg Gardens has long been associated with theatres and entertainment. While a number of the earlier theatres are now closed, theBetty Nansen TeatretBetty Nansen Theatreand Aveny-T are still active.cite webhttp://oplev.frederiksberg.dk/turister-top/museer-og-teatre-paa-frederiksbergMuseer og teatre på FrederiksbergOplev Frederiksberg2 December 2013Danish
article.heading: Other districts
article.paragraph: Not far fromCopenhagen Airporton theKastrupcoast,National Aquarium DenmarkThe Blue Planetcompleted in March 2013 now houses the national aquarium. With its 53 aquariums, it is the largest facility of its kind in Scandinavia.cite webhttp://www.denblaaplanet.dk/en/about-the-blue-planet/About The Blue PlanetDen Blå Planet7 December 2013Grundtvig's Church, located in the northern suburb ofBispebjerg, was designed byP.V. Jensen Klintand completed in 1940. A rare example ofExpressionist architectureExpressionistchurch architecture, its strikingwestworkwest faadeis reminiscent of a church organ.cite webhttps://web.archive.org/web/20110717125340/http://www.tyznik.com/analysis/grundtvigs/Michael TyznikGrundtvigs KirkeWeb Archive: Michael Tyznik design portfolio7 December 2013
article.heading: Culture and contemporary life
article.paragraph: File:Copenhagen - the little mermaid statue - 2013.jpgthumbuprightThe statue ofThe Little Mermaid (statue)the Little Mermaid, an icon of the city and a popular tourist attraction.Apart from being the national capital, Copenhagen also serves as the cultural hub of Denmark and wider Scandinavia. Since the late 1990s, it has undergone a transformation from a modest Scandinavian capital into a metropolitan city of international appeal in the same league asBarcelonaandAmsterdam.cite webhttp://wissen.spiegel.de/wissen/image/show.html?didCool Boom TownsSpiegel Special9 January 2009This is a result of huge investments in infrastructure and culture as well as the work of successful new Danish architects, designers and chefs.cite webhttp://www.nytimes.com/2007/06/18/travel/18iht-rmon2copenhagen.6190610.html?_rCopenhagen is Scandinavia's most desirable city''New York Times''Stuart Husband19 June 200721 November 2013Copenhagen Fashion Week, the largest fashion event in Northern Europe, takes place every year in February and August.cite webhttp://www.nysun.com/style/unexpected-fashion-capital/65912/An Unexpected Fashion CapitalNew York Sun6 November 20079 March 2013Pia Cattoncite webhttp://www.copenhagenfashionweek.com/Copenhagen Fashion WeekCopenhagen Fashion Week9 March 2013
article.heading: Museums

template.arg: List of museums in and around Copenhagen

article.paragraph: Copenhagen has a wide array of museums of international standing. TheNational Museum of DenmarkNational Museum,Nationalmuseet, is Denmark's largest museum ofarchaeologyandcultural history, comprising the histories of Danish and foreign cultures alike.cite webhttp://natmus.dk/en/the-national-museum-of-denmark/Nationalmuseet: National Museum of DenmarkNationalmuseet21 November 2013Denmark'sStatens Museum for KunstNational Gallery(Statens Museum for Kunst) is the national art museum with collections dating from the 12th century to the present. In addition to Danish painters, artists represented in the collections includePeter Paul RubensRubens,Rembrandt,Pablo PicassoPicasso,Georges BraqueBraque,Fernand LgerLger,Henri MatisseMatisse,Emil Nolde,Olafur Eliasson,Elmgreen and Dragset,SuperflexandJens Haaning.cite webhttp://www.smk.dk/en/about-smk/who-are-we/Who are we?SMK21 November 2013

File:Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek - entrance.jpgthumbleftNy Carlsberg Glyptotekart museumAnother important Copenhagen art museum is theNy Carlsberg Glyptotekfounded by second generationCarlsberg GroupCarlsbergphilanthropistCarl Jacobsenand built around his personal collections. Its main focus is classicalAncient EgyptEgyptian,Roman EmpireRomanandAncient GreeceGreeksculptures and antiquities and a collection ofAuguste RodinRodinsculptures, the largest outside France. Besides its sculpture collections, the museum also holds a comprehensive collection of paintings ofimpressionismImpressionistandPost-ImpressionismPost-Impressionistpainters such asClaude MonetMonet,Pierre-Auguste RenoirRenoir,Paul CzanneCzanne,Vincent van Goghvan GoghandHenri de Toulouse-LautrecToulouse-Lautrecas well as works by the DanishGolden Agepainters.cite webhttp://www.aok.dk/udstilling/ny-carlsberg-glyptotekNy Carlsberg GlyptotekAOK21 November 2013Danish

Louisiana Museum of Modern ArtLouisianais aMuseum of Modern Artmuseum of modern artsituated on the coast just north of Copenhagen. It is located in the middle of a sculpture garden on a cliff overlookingresund. Its collection of over 3,000 items includes works byPicasso,Alberto GiacomettiGiacomettiandDubuffet.cite webhttp://www.louisiana.dk/dk/Service+Menu+Right/EnglishLouisianaLouisiana21 November 2013TheDanish Museum of Art & DesignDanish Design Museumis housed in the 18th-century formerFrederiks Hospitaland displaysDanish designas well as international design and crafts.cite webhttp://designmuseum.dk/enDesign MuseumDesign Museum Danmark21 November 2013

Other museums include: theThorvaldsens Museum, dedicated to theWork of artoeuvreof romantic Danish sculptorBertel Thorvaldsenwho lived and worked in Rome;cite webhttp://www.thorvaldsensmuseum.dk/en/themuseum/themuseumThorvaldsens MuseumThorvaldsens Museum21 November 2013theCisternernemuseum dedicated to modernStudio glassglass art, located in formercisternsthat come complete withstalactitesformed by the changing water levels;cite webhttp://www.visitdenmark.com/denmark/cisternerne--museum-of-modern-glass-art-gdk414124Cisternerne -Museum of Modern Glass ArtVisit Denmark21 November 2013and theOrdrupgaardOrdrupgaard Museum, located just north of Copenhagen, which features 19th-century French and Danish art and is noted for its works byPaul Gauguin.cite webhttp://www.ordrupgaard.dk/topics/collection-and-architecture.aspxCollection and ArchitectureOrdrupgaard21 November 2013
article.heading: Entertainment and performing arts
article.paragraph: File:Copenhagen Theatre and Opera.jpgthumbrightTheRoyal Danish Playhouse(left) andCopenhagen Opera HouseOpera House(background, right)The newCopenhagen Concert Hallopened in January 2009. Designed byJean Nouvel, it has four halls with the mainauditoriumseating 1,800 people. It serves as the home of theDanish National Symphony Orchestraand along with theWalt Disney Concert Hallin Los Angeles is the most expensive concert hall ever built.cite webhttp://www.b.dk/danmark/drs-koncerthus-et-af-verdens-dyresteDRs koncerthus – et af verdens dyresteBerlingske Tidende9 January 2009Another important venue for classical music is theTivoli Concert Halllocated in theTivoli Gardens.cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/tivoli-concert-hall-gdk474728Tivoli Concert HallVisit Copenhagen21 November 2013Designed byHenning Larsen, theCopenhagen Opera House(Operaen) opened in 2005. It is among the most modern opera houses in the world.cite webhttp://www.henninglarsen.com/projects/0400-0599/0553-the-opera-copenhagen.aspxThe Opera in CopenhagenHenning Larsen Architects21 November 2013TheRoyal Danish Theatrealso stages opera in addition to its drama productions. It is also home to theRoyal Danish Ballet. Founded in 1748 along with the theatre, it is one of the oldest ballet troupes in Europe noted for itsBournonville SchoolBournonville styleof ballet.cite webhttp://kglteater.dk/about-us/teatrets-historieHistoryDet Kongelige Teater21 November 2013File:Royal Danish Theatre, Copenhagen.jpgthumbleftTheRoyal Danish Theatremain buildingCopenhagen has a significantjazzscene that has existed for many years. It developed when a number of AmericanList of jazz musiciansjazz musicianssuch asBen Webster,Thad Jones,Richard B. BooneRichard Boone, Ernie Wilkins,Kenny Drew,Ed Thigpen, Bob Rockwell,Dexter Gordon, and others such asguitaristrock guitaristLink Wraycame to live in Copenhagen during the 1960s. Every year in early July, Copenhagen's streets, squares, parks as well as cafs and concert halls fill up with big and small jazz concerts during theCopenhagen Jazz Festival. One of Europe's top jazz festivals, the annual event features around 900 concerts at 100 venues with over 200,000 guests from Denmark and around the world.sfnO'Brien200520

The largest venue forpopular musicin Copenhagen isVega, CopenhagenVegain theVesterbro, CopenhagenVesterbrodistrict. It was chosen as "best concert venue in Europe" by international music magazineLive. The venue has three concert halls: the great hall, Store Vega, accommodates audiences of 1,550, the middle hall, Lille Vega, has space for 500 and Ideal Bar Live has a capacity of 250.cite webhttp://vega.dk/faq/vega.htmlPræsentation af VEGAvega.dk22 November 2013DanishEvery September since 2006, the Festival of Endless Gratitude (FOEG) has taken place in Copenhagen. This festival focuses onindie artindiecounterculture,experimental rockexperimental pop musicandleft fieldmusic combined withvisual artsexhibitions.cite webhttp://festivalofendlessgratitude.dk/Festival of Endless GratitudeFestival of Endless Gratitude22 November 2013Danish

Copenhagen is home to the "K-Town"punk rockpunkandHardcore punkhardcoremusic community. This community developed around theunderground scenevenueUngdomshusetin the late 90's punk scene, with punk- and hardcore acts such as Snipers, Amdi Petersens Arm, Gorilla Angreb, Young Wasteners, and No Hope For The Kids emerging as significant bands.cite webhttps://livinginthecityzine.wordpress.com/2015/08/24/spring-2014-the-origins-of-k-town/Living In The CityLiving In The City28 August 2015The term "K-town" got international recognition within the punk-scene with the emergence of "K-Town" festivals. In 2001, the first of these was held in Ungdomshuset, onJagtvej 69,Nrrebro, Copenhagen.cite webhttp://de.indymedia.org/2001/05/2432.shtmlIndymedia.deIndymedia28 August 2015The festival temporarily moved toFreetown Christianiaafter Ungdomshuset was evicted from its original location until a new Ungdomshuset location was opened on Dortheavej 61.cite webHistoryhttp://ktownhardcorefest.org/about/history/K-Town Hardcore FestK-Town Hardcore Fest28 August 2015

For free entertainment one can stroll alongStrget, especially betweenNytorvandHjbro Plads, which in the late afternoon and evening is a bit like an impromptu three-ringcircuswith musicians,magic (illusion)magicians,jugglingjugglersand otherbuskingstreet performers.cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/stroget-gdk414471StrøgetVisit Copenhagen22 November 2013
article.heading: Literature
article.paragraph: File:Koebenhavns Hovedbibliotek midterparti.JPGthumb160pxCopenhagen's main public libraryMost of Denmarks's major publishing houses are based in Copenhagen.sfnChisholm1911These include the book publishersGyldendalandAkademisk Forlagand newspaper publishersBerlingskeandJP/Politikens HusPolitiken(the latter also publishing books).cite webhttp://wessweb.info/index.php/Scandinavian_Book_Trade,_Publishers,_etc.Scandinavian Book Trade, Publishers, etcWess Web30 November 2013cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Samfund,_jura_og_politik/Massemedier/Trykte_medier_og_dagblade,_Danmark/JP_Politikens_Hus_AS?highlightJP/Politikens Hus A/S''Den Store Danske''30 November 2013DanishMany of the most important contributors to Danish literature such as Hans Christian Andersen (18051875) with his fairy tales, the philosopher Sren Kierkegaard (18131855) and playwrightLudvig Holberg(16841754) spent much of their lives in Copenhagen. Novels set in Copenhagen includeBaby (Thorup novel)Baby(1973) byKirsten Thorup,The Copenhagen Connection (novel)The Copenhagen Connection(1982) byBarbara Mertz,Number the Stars(1989) byLois Lowry,Miss Smilla's Feeling for Snow(1992) andBorderliners(1993) byPeter Heg,Music and Silence(1999) byRose Tremain,The Danish Girl(2000) byDavid Ebershoff, andSharpe's Prey(2001) byBernard Cornwell.Michael Frayn's 1998 playCopenhagen (play)Copenhagenabout the meeting between thephysicistsNiels BohrandWerner Heisenbergin 1941 is also set in the city. From 1518 August 1973, an oral literature conference took place in Copenhagen as part of the 9th International Congress of Anthropological and Ethnological Sciences.sfnJasonSegal19777

TheRoyal Library, DenmarkRoyal Library, Denmark's national library, which also serves as the library of theUniversity of Copenhagenis the largest library in the Nordic countries with an almost complete collection of all printed Danish books since 1482. Founded in 1648, the library is located at four sites in the city, the main one being on the Slotsholmen waterfront.cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Kunst_og_kultur/Bog-_og_biblioteksv%C3%A6sen/Videnskabelige_og_faglige_biblioteker/Det_Kongelige_BibliotekDet Kongelige Bibliotek''Den Store Danske''30 November 2013DanishCopenhagen's public library network has over 20 outlets, the largest being the Central Library (Kbenhavns Hovedbibliotek) onKrystalgadein the inner city.cite webhttp://www.folkebiblioteker.dk/kkb/kkb.htmKøbenhavns HovedbibliotekFolkebibliotekerne30 November 2013Danish
article.heading: Art
article.paragraph: File:Statens Museum for Kunst.jpgthumbleft150pxInterior of the National Gallery (Statens Museum for Kunst), combining new and old architectureCopenhagen has a wide selection of art museums and galleries displaying both historic works and more modern contributions. They includeStatens Museum for Kunst, i.e. the Danish national gallery, in thestre Anlgpark, and the adjacentHirschsprung Collectionspecialising in the 19th and early 20th century.Kunsthal Charlottenborgin the city centre exhibits national and international contemporary art.Den Frie Udstillingnear thesterport Stationexhibits paintings created and selected by contemporary artists themselves rather than by the official authorities. TheArken Museum of Modern Artis located in southwesternIshj.cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/art/top-10-art-museumsTop 10 art museumsVisit Copenhagen3 December 2013Among artists who have painted scenes of Copenhagen areMartinus Rrbye(18031848),cite webhttp://www.smk.dk/en/explore-the-art/highlights/martinus-roerbye-the-prison-of-copenhagen/Martinus Rørbye (1803–48), The Prison of Copenhagen, 1831Statens Museum for Kunst3 December 2013Christen Kbke(18101848)cite webhttp://www.smk.dk/en/explore-the-art/visit-the-conservator/stories-from-the-conservators/christen-koebke/Christen Købke's View of a Street in Østerbro outside Copenhagen. Morning light, 1836Statens Museum for Kunst3 December 2013and the prolificPaul Gustav Fischer(18601934).cite webhttp://nimbhotelmagazine.dk/blog/articles/paul-fischer-a-danish-painter-of-the-grand-salon/Jane SandbergPaul Fischer — A Danish painter of the Grand SalonNimb3 December 2013

A number of notable sculptures can be see in the city. In addition to the Little Mermaid on the waterfront, there are two historic equestrian statues in the city centre:Jacques Saly'sFrederik V on Horseback(1771) in Amalienborg Squarecite webhttp://www.kulturarv.dk/1001fortaellinger/en_GB/saly-s-equestrian-statue/images/newest/1/img-1289Saly's Equestrian StatueLouise Straarup-HansenKurturarv4 November 2013and the statue ofChristian V of DenmarkChristian Von Kongens Nytorv created by Abraham-Csar Lamoureux in 1688 who was inspired by the statue ofLouis XIII of FranceLouis XIIIin Paris.cite bookHans Edvard Nørregård-NielsenDansk kunst: tusind års kunsthistoriehttps://books.google.com/books?id2009Gyldendal A/S978-87-02-08873-1137–List of public art in Rosenborg Castle GardensRosenborg Castle Gardenscontains several sculptures and monuments includingAugust Saabye's Hans Christian Andersen,Aksel Hansen's Echo, andVilhelm Bissen'sCaroline Amalie of AugustenburgDowager Queen Caroline Amalie.cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Danmarks_geografi_og_historie/Danmarks_geografi/Danske_slotte_og_herreg%C3%A5rde/Rosenborg_SlotRosenborg Slot''Den Store Danske''4 December 2013Danish

Copenhagen is believed to have invented thephotomarathonphotography competition, which has been held in the City each year since 1989.Photomarathons: Using New Technologies to Support Student Learning and Assessment, Dr Simon Jones, Leeds Metropolitan University, accessed 28 July 2014About us, FotoMarathon.dk, accessed 28 July 2014
article.heading: Cuisine
article.paragraph: Fora broader look at this topicDanish cuisineFile:Noma entrance.jpgthumbrightNoma (restaurant)Nomais an example of Copenhagen's renowned experimental restaurants, and has gained twoMichelin stars.As of 2014, Copenhagen has 15Michelin GuideMichelin-starredrestaurants, the most of any Scandinavian city.cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/gastronomy/michelin-starred-restaurantsMichelin-starred restaurantsVisit Copenhagen14 May 2014The city is increasingly recognized internationally as a gourmet destination.The Top 10 cities to visit in 2009, TimesOnlineThese include Den Rde Cottage, Formel B Restaurant, Grnbech & Churchill, Sllerd Kro, Kadeau, Kiin Kiin (Denmark's first Michelin-starred Asian gourmet restaurant), the French restaurant Kong Hans Klder, Rel, Restaurant AOC, and, each with two Michelin stars,Geranium (restaurant)GeraniumandNoma (restaurant)Noma(short for Danish:nordiskmad, English: Nordic food). Noma, was ranked as theRestaurant (magazine) Top 50Best Restaurant in the WorldbyRestaurant (magazine)Restaurantin 2010, 2011, 2012, and again in 2014,cite webnomahttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/noma-gdk412536Visit Copenhagen14 May 2014sparking interest in theNew Nordic Cuisine.cite newshttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/foodanddrink/foodanddrinknews/7635378/Noma-in-Copenhagen-named-best-restaurant-in-the-world.htmlThe TelegraphNoma in Copenhagen named best restaurant in the world26 April 2010Harry Wallop

Apart from the selection of upmarket restaurants, Copenhagen offers a great variety of Danish, ethnic and experimental restaurants. It is possible to find modest eateries servingopen sandwiches, known assmrrebrda traditional, Danish lunch dish; however, most restaurants serve international dishes.cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/gastronomy/top-10-traditional-danish-lunchTop 10 traditional Danish lunchVisit Copenhagen22 November 2013Danish pastrycan be sampled from any of numerous bakeries found in all parts of the city. The Copenhagen Baker's Association dates back to the 1290s and Denmark's oldest confectioner's shop still operating,Conditori La Glace, was founded in 1870 in Skoubogade by Nicolaus Henningsen, a trained master baker fromFlensburg.cite webhttp://www.kbh-bagerlaug.dk/Om-lauget.aspxHistorien om Københavns bagerlaugKbh-bagerlaug.dkDanish9 March 2013

Copenhagen has long been associated with beer.Carlsberg GroupCarlsbergbeer has been brewed at the brewery's premises on the border between theVesterbro, CopenhagenVesterbroandValbydistricts since 1847 and has long been almost synonymous withBeer in DenmarkDanish beerproduction. However, recent years have seen an explosive growth in the number ofmicrobrewerymicrobreweriesso that Denmark today has more than 100 breweries, many of which are located in Copenhagen. Some likeNrrebro Bryghusalso act asbrewpubswhere it is also possible to eat on the premises.cite webhttp://www.dev-bryggeriforeningen.dk/default.asp?pidNyeste artikler fra BryggeriforeningenDev-bryggeriforeningen.dkDanish9 March 2013cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/nightlife/top-10-beerTop 10 beerVisit Copenhagen22 November 2013
article.heading: Nightlife and festivals
article.paragraph: File:Copenhagen Pride 2008 i.JPGthumbrightCopenhagenPride Parade, 2008Copenhagen has one of the highest number of restaurants and bars per capita in the world. The nightclubs and bars stay open until 5 or 6 in the morning, some even longer. Denmark has a very liberal alcohol culture and a strong tradition for beer breweries, although binge drinking is frowned upon and the Danish Police takedriving under the influencevery seriously.cite webhttps://www.retsinformation.dk/forms/R0710.aspx?idFærdselsloven - Bekendtgørelse af færdselslovenretsinformation.dk9 March 2013Inner city areas such asIstedgadeandEnghave PladsinVesterbro (Copenhagen)Vesterbro,Sankt Hans TorvinNrrebroand certain places inFrederiksbergare vibrant and full of life even during the late hours. Notable nightclubs include Bakken Kbh, HIVE, Jolene, The Jane on Grbrdre Square, Karriere Bar, KB3, Rust, Vega Nighclub, Culture Box and Gefhrlich, which also serves as a bar, caf, restaurant, and art gallery.cite webhttp://www.visitcopenhagen.com/copenhagen/nightlife/top-10-nightclubsTop 10 nightclubsVisit Copenhagen22 November 2013

Copenhagen has several recurring community festivals, mainly in the summer.Copenhagen Carnivalhas taken place every year since 1982 during theWhitsunHoliday inFlledparkenand around the city with the participation of 120 bands, 2,000 dancers and 100,000 spectators.cite webhttp://www.copenhagenet.dk/CPH-History.htmHistory of Copenhagen-In BriefCopenhagan Portal.dk30 May 2009Copenhagen Prideis agay pridegay pride festivaltaking place every year in August. Among the events is "Tivoli goes pink" which ends with a parade.Copenhagen Distortionis ayouth subcultureyouth culturefestival capturing the zeitgeist of the city. Every year (five days up to the first weekend of June) it attracts up to 100,000 people in the streets, shops, galleries, clubs, bars, in boats and buses, with a cultural focus on street culture, art and upfrontdance music.cite webhttp://common.berlingskemedia.net/www.urbankbh.dk/natteliv/distortions-historie-fra-tivoli-til-tistortionDistortions historie: Fra Tivoli til TistortionBerlingskemedia6 January 201222 November 2013Danish

Since 2010 the old B&W Shipyard at Refshaleen in the Copenhagen harbour has been the location for the outdoor music festival Copenhell, taking place every year in mid June. The festival is a large gathering for heavy metal, hard rock and punk rock culture with concerts and other on-site entertainment drawing thousands of visitors every year. Its location close to the center of Copenhagen provides its visitors easy and quick access to Copenhagen both by public transportation and bicycle, as well as providing visitors with the possibility of accommodation in the citys many hostels and hotels. Since its inception in 2010 the festival has hosted concerts by such acts asAlice in Chains,Judas Priest,Megadeth,Slayerand many more.cite webhttp://copenhell.dk/previous-lineups/previous lineups
article.heading: Amusement parks
article.paragraph: File:Pantomime Theatre.jpgthumbrightThePantomimeteatretPantomime Theatre, opened in1874, is the oldest building in theTivoli GardensCopenhagen has the two oldestamusement parksin the world.cite webhttp://www.aok.dk/byen-rundt/bakkenDyrehavsbakkenAOK5 January 2009cite webTourist Press Travel Trade Meeting Plannerhttp://www.visitdenmark.com/tivoli-gardens-gdk424504Tivoli GardenslnVisitDenmark9 March 2013

Dyrehavsbakken, a fair-ground and pleasure-park established in 1583, is located inKlampenborgjust north of Copenhagen in a forested area known asJgersborg DyrehaveDyrehaven. Created as an amusement park complete with rides, games and restaurants byChristian IV of DenmarkChristian IV, it is the oldest surviving amusement park in the world.Pierrot#DenmarkPierrot(lang-danoPjerrot), a nitwit dressed in white with a scarlet grin wearing a boat-like hat while entertaining children, remains one of the park's key attractions. In Danish, Dyrehavsbakken is often abbreviated asBakken. There is no entrance fee to pay andKlampenborg Stationon theC (S-train)C-line, is situated nearby.cite webhttp://www.bakken.dk/englishThe history of DyrehavsbakkenBakken22 November 2013

TheTivoli Gardensis an amusementparkand pleasuregardenlocated in central Copenhagen between theThe City Hall Square, CopenhagenCity Hall Squareand theCopenhagen Central StationCentral Station. It opened in 1843, making it the second oldest amusement park in the world. Among its rides are the oldest still operating rollercoasterRutschebanenfrom 1915 and the oldestferris wheelstill in use, opened in 1943.cite webhttp://www.welcome-to-my-copenhagen.com/tivoli_gardens_copenhagen.htmlTivoli Gardens Copenhagen - The RidesWelcome to My CopenhaganAnders Holte20139 March 2013Tivoli Gardens also serves as a venue for variousperforming artsand as an active part of the cultural scene in Copenhagen.cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Livsstil,_sport_og_fritid/Underholdning_og_spil/Forestillinger_og_forlystelser/Forlystelsessteder_og_-parker/Tivoli?highlightTivoli''Den Store Danske''22 November 2013Danish
article.heading: Education
article.paragraph: File:University Main Building.jpgthumb280pxleftTheUniversity of Copenhagenmain buildingCopenhagen has over 94,000 students enrolled in its largest universities and institutions:University of Copenhagen(38,867 students),cite webhttp://introduction.ku.dk/facts_and_figures/students/students/Introduction: StudentsUniversity of Copenhagen22 November 2013Copenhagen Business School(19,999 students),cite webhttp://www.cbs.dk/cbs/noegletal-rapporter-reglerNøgletal, rapporter og reglerCBS22 November 2013Metropolitan University CollegeandUniversity College Capital(10,000 students each),cite webhttp://www.ucc.dk/uddannelser/studerendepaaucc/?navStuderende på UCCUCC22 November 2013DanishTechnical University of Denmark(7,000 students),cite webhttp://www.itu.dk/en/Om-IT-UniversitetetAbout the IT University of CopenhagenITU22 November 2013KEA (c. 4,500 students),cite webhttp://www.kea.dk/da/topmenu/om-kea/Velkommen til KEAKEA22 November 2013DanishIT University of Copenhagen(2,000 students) andAalborg University Copenhagen(2,300 students).cite webhttp://www.en.cph.aau.dk/about/About Aalborg University CopenhagenAalborg University22 November 2013

Copenhagen's higher-education system relies onpublic universitypublic universities. Most prominent among these is theUniversity of Copenhagen. Founded in 1479, it is the oldest university in Denmark. A world-renowned research and teaching institution with campuses around the city, it forms part of theInternational Alliance of Research Universities(IARU), which encourages international collaboration between top universities includingOxford UniversityOxford,Cambridge UniversityCambridge,Yale UniversityYale,University of California, BerkeleyBerkeleyandAustralian National UniversityThe Australian National University. The University attracts some 1,500 international and exchange students every year.It has repeatedly been ranked as one of the best universities in Europe.cite webhttp://www.topuniversities.com/university-rankings/world-university-rankings/2013#sortingQS World University Rankings 2013QS8 December 2013File:Tietgenkollegiet - courtyard.jpgthumbuprightStudent housingTietgenkollegietTheTechnical University of Denmark(DTU),Danmarks Tekniske Universitet, is located inKongens LyngbyLyngbyin the northern outskirts of Copenhagen. In 2013, it was ranked as one of the leading technical universities in Northern Europe.cite webhttp://www.topuniversities.com/universities/technical-university-denmark/undergradTechnical University of DenmarkQS8 December 2013

TheIT University of Copenhagenis Denmark's youngest university, a mono-faculty institution focusing on technical, societal and business aspects of information technology.cite webhttp://www.topuniversities.com/universities/it-university-copenhagen/undergrad IT University of Copenhagen QS8 December 2013

The Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts(Det Kongelige Danske Kunstakademi) has provided a practice-oriented complement to the scholarly investigation of the arts carried out at Danish universities for more than 250 years. It includes the historical School of Visual Arts, and has in later years come to include aKunstakademiets ArkitektskoleSchool of Architecture, aDanmarks DesignskoleSchool of Designand a School of Conservation.cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Kunst_og_kultur/Billedkunst/Kunstens_institutioner/Det_Kongelige_Danske_KunstakademiDet Kongelige Danske Kunstakademi''Den Store Danske''8 December 2013DanishCopenhagen Business School(CBS) is anEuropean Quality Improvement SystemEQUIS-accredited business school located inFrederiksberg MunicipalityFrederiksberg.cite webhttp://www.topuniversities.com/universities/copenhagen-business-school/undergradCopenhagen Business SchoolQS8 December 2013There are also branches of bothUniversity College CapitalandMetropolitan University Collegeinside and outside Copenhagen.cite webhttp://studyindenmark.dk/study-options/danish-higher-education-institutions/university-colleges/university-college-capitalUniversity College Capital (UCC)Study in Denmark22 January 2014cite webhttp://studyindenmark.dk/study-options/danish-higher-education-institutions/university-colleges/metropolitan-university-collegeMetropolitan University CollegeStudy in Denmark22 January 2014
article.heading: Sport
article.paragraph: The city has a variety of sporting teams. The majorassociation footballfootballteams are the historically successfulF.C. CopenhagenFC Kbenhavncite webhttp://www.uefa.com/teamsandplayers/teams/clubFC KøbenhavnUEFA.com2 December 2013andBrndby IFBrndby. FC Kbenhavn plays atParken StadiumParkenin sterbro. Formed in 1992, it is a merger of two older Copenhagen clubs, B 1903 (from the inner suburb Gentofte) and KB (from Frederiksberg).cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Livsstil,_sport_og_fritid/Sport/Fodbold_-_Danmark/FC_K%C3%B8benhavn?highlightFC København''Den Store Danske''2 December 2013DanishBrndby plays atBrndby Stadionin the inner suburb ofBrndbyvester.BK Fremis based in the southern part of Copenhagen (Sydhavnen, Valby). Other teams areFC Nordsjlland(from suburbanFarum),Fremad Amager,Boldklubben 1893B93,Akademisk BoldklubAB,Lyngby BoldklubLyngbyandHvidovre IF.cite webhttp://www.nysport.dk/sportsklubber-i-kommunen.aspx?pageidSportsklubber i København KommuneNysport.dk2 December 2013Danish

File:Copenhagen Marathon 2008.jpgthumbleftCopenhagen Marathon2008Copenhagen has severalteam handballhandball teamsa sport which is particularly popular in Denmark. Of clubs playing in the "highest" leagues, there are Ajax, Ydun, and HIK (Hellerup).TheKbenhavn Hndboldwomen's club has recently been established.cite webhttp://www.dr.dk/Sporten/Haandbold/Liga_kvinder/2013/02/28/113234.htmKøbenhavn Håndbold er en realitet''DR''28 February 20132 December 2013DanishCopenhagen also hasice hockeyteams, of which three play in the top league,Rdovre Mighty Bulls,Herlev HornetsHerlev EaglesandHvidovre Ligahockeyall inner suburban clubs.Kjbenhavns SkjtelberforeningCopenhagen Ice Skating Clubfounded in 1869 is the oldest ice hockey team in Denmark but is no longer in the top league.cite webhttp://www.ksf.dk/klub-information/historie/Klubbens historieKSF2 December 2013Danish

Rugby unionis also played in the Danish capital with teams such asCSR-Nanok, Copenhagen Business School Sport Rugby,Frederiksberg RKandRK SpeedRugbyklubben Speed.Rugby Leagueis now played in Copenhagen, with the national team playing out ofGentofte Stadion. TheDanish Australian Football League, based in Copenhagen is the largestAustralian rules footballcompetition outside of theEnglish speaking world.cite webhttp://www.rugby.dk/kontakt/klubberKlubberDansk Rugby Union2 December 2013Danish

Copenhagen Marathon, Copenhagen's annualmarathonevent, was established in 1980.cite webCopenhagen Marathonhttp://www.copenhagenmarathon.dk/en/18 February 2013Slotsholmen#Round Christiansborg Open Water SwimRound Christiansborg Open Water Swim Raceis a 2 km (1.2 mi)open water swimmingcompetition taking place each year in late August.cite webhttp://www.svoem.org/Discipliner/Aabent-vand/Round-Christiansborg-competition/Round Christiansborg competition 2013Dansk Svømmeunion2 December 2013DanishThis amateur event is combined with aconvert10km0onDanish championship.cite webhttp://www.10kswim.com/circumnavigationSwims.htmlOpen Water Swimming: World's Top 100 Open Water SwimsOpen Water Swimming1 May 2009In 2009 the event included aconvert10km0onFINA World Cup competition in the morning. Copenhagen hosted the2011 UCI Road World Championshipsin September 2011, taking advantage of its bicycle-friendly infrastructure. It was the first time that Denmark had hosted the event since 1956, when it was also held in Copenhagen.cite webInformationhttp://www.copenhagen2011.dk/information/Copenhagen 2011 - UCI Road World Championship19 February 2013
article.heading: Transport
article.paragraph: mainTransport in Copenhagensee alsoTransport in DenmarkCycling advocacy#CopenhagenizationFile:KastrupAirport Panorama.jpgthumbrightupright=1.25Copenhagen Airport, KastrupThe greater Copenhagen area has a very well established transportation infrastructure making it a hub in Northern Europe.Copenhagen Airport, opened in 1925, is Scandinavia's largest airport, located inKastrupon the island of Amager. It is connected to the city centre by metro and main line railway services.cite webhttp://www.flightstats.com/go/Airport/airportDetails.do?airportCodeCPH Copenhagen AirportFlightStats.com25 November 2013October 2013 was a record month with 2.2 million passengers, and November 2013 figures reveal that the number of passengers is increasing by some 3% annually, about 50% more than the European average.cite webhttp://www.moodiereport.com/document.php?doc_idDermot DavittCopenhagen Airport posts solid increase in passenger trafficThe Moodie Report25 November 2013

File:Hugh llewelyn 9150 (5707619100).jpgthumbleft4th generationS-trainatCopenhagen Central StationCopenhagen has an extensive road network including motorways connecting the city to other parts of Denmark and to Sweden over theresund Bridge.cite webhttps://subsite.kk.dk/sitecore/content/Subsites/CityOfCopenhagen/SubsiteFrontpage/~/media/BF3A66B079AB4ACAA6CA167ECF151EB3.ashxTraffic in Copenhagen 2009Niels TørsløvMay 2010Copenhagen Traffic Department25 November 2013The car is still the most popular form of transport within the city itself, representing two-thirds of all distances travelled. This can however lead to serious congestion in rush hour traffic.cite webhttp://www.cphpost.dk/news/local/committee-presents-ideas-reducing-copenhagens-congestionPeter StannersCommittee presents ideas for reducing Copenhagen's congestionThe Copenhagen Post25 November 2013Copenhagen is also served by a daily ferry connection toOsloin Norway.cite webhttp://www.aok.dk/byen-rundt/dfds-seawaysDFDS SeawaysAOK25 November 2013In 2012, Copenhagen Harbour handled 372 cruise ships and 840,000 passengers.

File:Copenhagen bicycles at Christianshavn Metro Station.JPGthumbThe intense use of bicycles here illustrated at theChristianshavnMetro StationTheS-trainCopenhagen S-Train,Copenhagen Metroand the regional train networks are used by about half of the city's passengers, the remainder using bus services.Nrreport Stationnear the city centre serves passengers travelling by main-line rail, S-train, regional train, metro and bus. Some 750,000 passengers make use of public transport facilities every day.Copenhagen Central Stationis the hub of theDSB (railway company)DSBrailway network serving Denmark and international destinations.cite webhttp://www.dsb.dk/om-dsb/in-english/Travelling in DenmarkDSB25 November 2013

The Danish capital is known as one of the mostbicycle-friendlycities in the world, with bicycles actually outnumbering its inhabitants.cite webhttp://www.virgin-vacations.com/site_vv/11-most-bike-friendly-cities.asp11 most bicycle-friendly cities in the worldVirgin Vacations5 January 2009cite webCopenhagen's piles of bicycleshttp://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-29601069BBCBBC18 October 2014In 2012 some 36% of all working or studying city-dwellers cycled to work, school, or university. With 1.27 million km covered every working day byCycling in CopenhagenCopenhagen's cyclists(including both residents and commuters), and 75% of Copenhageners cycling throughout the year.cite webBicycle statisticshttp://subsite.kk.dk/sitecore/content/Subsites/CityOfCopenhagen/SubsiteFrontpage/LivingInCopenhagen/CityAndTraffic/CityOfCyclists/CycleStatistics.aspxsubsite.kk.dkCity of Copenhagen18 October 2014The city'sCycling infrastructurebicycle pathsare extensive and well used, boasting 400 km of cycle lanes not shared with cars or pedestrians, and sometimes have their own signal systems - giving the cyclists a lead of a couple of seconds to accelerate.cite webhttp://denmark.dk/en/green-living/bicycle-culture/cycling-in-copenhagen---the-easy-way/Cycling in Copenhagen — the easy wayDenmarkLasse Lindholm24 November 2013Clear
article.heading: Healthcare
article.paragraph: Promoting health is an extremely important issue for Copenhagen's municipal authorities. Central to its sustainability mission is its "Long Live Copenhagen" (Lnge Leve Kbenhavn) scheme in which it has the goal of increasing the life expectancy of citizens, improving quality of life through better standards of health, and encouraging more productive lives and equal opportunities.cite webhttp://www.laengelevekbh.kk.dk/Vi vil forbedre københavnernes sundhedKøbenhavns KommuneDanish17 January 2014The city has targets to encourage people to exercise regularly and to reduce the number who smoke and consume alcohol.

Copenhagen University Hospitalforms a conglomerate of several hospitals inRegion HovedstadenandRegion Sjlland, together with the faculty ofhealth sciencesat the University of Copenhagen;RigshospitaletandBispebjerg Hospitalin Copenhagen belong to this group of university hospitals.sfnKjaerKrogsgaardMagnusson200811Rigshospitalet began operating in March 1757 as Frederiks Hospital,sfnSchaldemose2005107and became state-owned in 1903. With 1,120 beds, Rigshospitalet has responsibility for 65,000 inpatients and approximately 420,000 outpatients annually. It seeks to be the number one specialist hospital in the country, with an extensive team of researchers into cancer treatment, surgery and radiotherapy.cite webhttp://www.rigshospitalet.dk/RHenglish/Menu/Research/ResearchRigshospitalet24 November 2013In addition to its 8,000 personnel, the hospital has training and hosting functions. It benefits from the presence of in-service students of medicine and other healthcare sciences, as well as scientists working under a variety of research grants. The hospital became internationally famous as the location ofLars von Trier's television horror mini-seriesRigetThe Kingdom. Bispebjerg Hospital was built in 1913, and serves about 400,000 people in the Greater Copenhagen area, with some 3,000 employees.cite webhttp://www.bispebjerghospital.dk/topmenu/English/?siuAbout Bispebjerg HospitalBispebjerg Hospital24 November 2013Other large hospitals in the city includeAmager Hospital(1997),cite webhttp://www.amagerhospital.dk/topmenu/Om+Amager+Hospital/hospitalets_historie.htmAmager Hospitals historieAmager Hospital25 November 2013DanishHvidovre Hospital(1970),cite webhttp://www.hvidovrehospital.dk/menu/Om+Hvidovre+Hospital/Historie.htmHistorieHvidovre Hospital25 November 2013DanishandGentofte Hospital(1927).cite webhttp://gentoftehistorie.dk/historier/historie-1232550345-308425-16171.tklGentofte Hospital eller Amtssygehuset i GentofteGentofte Historie25 November 2013Danish
article.heading: Media
article.paragraph: File:Aller Media, Havneholmen, Copenhagen.jpgthumbuprightAller Mediaconglomerate building in HavneholmMany Danish media corporations are located in Copenhagen.DR (broadcaster)DR, the major Danishpublic broadcastingpublic servicebroadcasting corporation collected their activities in a new headquarters,DR Byen, in 2006 and 2007. SimilarlyTV 2 (Denmark)TV2which is based inOdensehas concentrated its Copenhagen activities in a modern media house inTeglholmen.cite webhttp://www.business.dk/article/20060515/nyhedsoversigt/105150198/TV2 samles på TeglholmenBerlingske Tidende10 January 2009The two national daily newspapersPolitikenandBerlingske Tidendeand the twotabloid (newspaper format)tabloidsEkstra BladetandB.T. (tabloid)B.T.are based in Copenhagen.cite webhttp://ejc.net/media_landscapes/denmarkGhita NørbyPer JauertMedia Landscapes: DenmarkEuropean Journalism Centre26 November 2013AlsoKristeligt Dagbladis based in Copenhagen and is published six days a week.http://ssl.director.dk/clients/k/2430_dm/index_tilbud1.phpOther important media corporations includeAller Mediawhich is the largest publisher of weekly and monthly magazines inScandinavia,cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Erhverv,_karriere_og_ledelse/Erhvervsliv/Erhvervsvirksomheder/AllerAller''Den Store Danske''26 November 2013DanishtheEgmont PublishingEgmontmedia conglomeratemedia groupcite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Erhverv,_karriere_og_ledelse/Erhvervsliv/Erhvervsvirksomheder/Egmont_Gruppen?highlightEgmont Gruppen''Den Store Danske''26 November 2013DanishandGyldendal, the largest Danish publisher of books.cite webhttp://www.denstoredanske.dk/Kunst_og_kultur/Bog-_og_biblioteksv%C3%A6sen/Boghandel_og_forlag/Gyldendal?highlightGyldendal''Den Store Danske''26 November 2013Danish

Copenhagen also has a sizable film and television industry.Nordisk Film, established in Valby, Copenhagen in 1906 is the oldest continuously operating film production company in the world.In 1992 it merged with the Egmont media group and currently runs the 17-screenPalads Cinemain Copenhagen.Filmbyen(movie city), located in a formermilitary campin the suburb ofHvidovre, houses several movie companies andmovie studiostudios. Among the movie companies isZentropa, co-owned by DanishFilm directormovie directorLars von Trierwho is behind several international movie productions as well as a founding force behind theDogme 95Dogme Movement.cite webhttp://www.kulturarv.dk/1001fortaellinger/da_DK/filmbyen-i-avedoerePeter SchepelernInternationalist med rejsefobiKulturarv26 November 2013DanishCPH:PIXis Copenhagen's international feature film festival, established in 2009 as a fusion of the 20-year-oldNatFilm FestivalNatfilm festivaland the four-year-old CIFF. The CPH:PIX festival takes place in mid-April.Copenhagen International Documentary FestivalCPH:DOXis Copenhagen's international documentary film festival, every year in November. On top of its documentary film programme of over 100 films, CPH:DOX includes a wideprogramme (booklet)event programmewith dozens of events, concerts, exhibitions and parties all over town.cite webhttp://www.cphpix.dkCph:PixCphpix.dk5 May 2009clear
